I have lots of things going on when I watch TV and I often lose track of where I put the remote. I can just wave my hand and then choose to change the channel, volume, change sources, etc with just waving my hand. Also, the touch mouse now works better after properly installing it. I guess it's not setup right out-of-the-box.05/17/2012 edit - reducing by one star to 4 stars because of the spot-lighting/edge-lighting issue on dark scenes. This is the only picture flaw I have found in the month that I have had it. Great picture otherwise.I bought the low-profile hanging wall mount and installed that myself to thick drywall with the drywall kit and it worked perfectly.04/13/2012 - Just received the 60" ES8000 today. Apologies for the poor quality in the video: iPhone 3GS video doesn't do this justice, but it's what I have for now so you'll have to deal with it or just look at all the other video reviews of this product. This video is playing through the YouTube app on the TV and over a 5mb/s wireless connection.So far the only issue I have is that it has to keep updating the software. At first it wouldn't update the firmware, but it must have been working in the background because it updated automatically while I was trying to download to USB from the Samsung site on my computer to transfer to the TV. Other than that update, it keeps updating the Apps menu so it has all the latest services. I guess this is to be expected and it's probably not going to need constant updates once it gets through this initial phase. For some reason I cannot get to the Samsung Apps store yet. Probably needs another software update for that.Other than that, the picture is amazing. No issues whatsoever with dead pixels or blemishes anywhere. The backing had no problem like one other review so that's a relief. Just an amazingly beautiful product.The web browsing is a bit clunky with the remote so I'm looking forward to getting a wireless keyboard and mouse for it. But I can get to my favorite video sites and it plays the free stuff like a champ.I do see some edge lighting when the screen goes black between transitions. I have not played with any settings yet so hopefully that doesn't become distracting.Will post updates as necessary.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV
Reviews.Author: Fly2high "Fly2High"
Reviews.Content: I decided to compare at home a Panasonic 55VT50, the so called top rated plasma from the 2012 HDTV Shootout to this one.  I hooked them both up to my DVR, one via HDMI and the other via component.  Since Best Buy offers a liberal return policy, I did the comparison at home right where they were to be used, side by side.  When one looked worse, I switched cables to ruleout the cables being the issue.I found the viewing angle of the Panasonic to be better but even though they were both hooked up to the same DVR (FIOS), the Samsung looked much sharper.  I turned the Panasonic's sharpness all the way up and down and could not get the picture as sharp.When I was watching Despicable Me at the end where they are trying to reach the farthest, the plasma looked grey whereas the Samsung was much whiter.  The plasma could not get the whites as white.  Also, during the rolling of the credits on a movie, the Panasonic was stuttering while the Samsung was scrolling cleanly.  The LED Samsung also could get much brighter than the plasma.Both have 3D but the depth on the Samsung is much deeper than on the Panasonic even when the depth is turned up all the way.The Samsung is not perfect.  the voice controls really work best when talking into the touch remote or within 9 or 10 ft or less and needs a rather quiet room.  If you use the microphone on the touch remote, it works very well but once you have a remote, why would you bother talking in commands.  They should make a remote microphone to enlarge the area usable for voice commands.The gesture controls work but, if you are Italian like me, you might find them going on occasionally. It really wasn't that often.I do see the clouding or flashlight effect in the corners but it only shows when the screen is nearly black.  The autodimming prevents it most of the time and when the picture is black, it shuts off the light.  It is not at all noticeable during normal viewing.  I find myself using either natural or movie mode and tend to keep the back-light down around 7-10.  That pretty much prevents it from coming out even during nearly dark credits.  Clouding/flashlight is really only noticeable during the credits on some movies.I chose the Samsung because the sharpness was better and the 3D was better and the set was much brighter.  I could not see any real difference in color or black level in my living room even though the black levels are metered to be darker on the Panasonic plasma.  I couldn't find a movie to show it.  I tried Sanctum, Green Lantern and Avatar.  In fact, during the scene where he first meets the girl and she saves him from those jackals and extinguishes his torch, the colors are sooo much more vibrant on the Samsung.  they felt muted and did not jump off the screen like on the Samsung.  Also, no tuning could make the Panasonic pop or show the whites as white as on the Samsung.Add to the fact that you get 4 universal 3D glasses with the Samsung, tons of apps, less wattage(LED 84-124 to 219-300 plasma) and a bigger screen, we decided that we could live with the shortcomings of the Samsung more than we could with the lack of brightness, lower and noticeable lack of sharpness and grey whites of the plasma.

Reviews.Title: overall a great TV for the current price. Best Black level for LED edge lit
Reviews.Author: howie
Reviews.Content: i've had the TV for about a week now. based on research and experience i would say the majority of the one or two star negative reviews here are from 65inch models, please refer to "Additional Comment" below. for me this was an upgrade exchange from ES6500 which had the infamous green halo trail. i got the 60ES8000. overall i would say the TV is great for its current street price.Pros:1. strong black level performance due to Micro Dimming. beautiful beautiful black. one of the best blacks i've seen for LCD/LED sets.2. best design esthetics. no need to elaborate more. it speaks for itself.3. best color representation right out of the box without too much tinckering. but of course if you're one of those who is hardcore about calibrating, you'll end up calibrating it anyway. but i am not that anal, although having work in the motion picture VFX industry, i do have a pretty trained eye and picky about quality. the set is pretty accurate and true right out of the box.4. slightly better viewing angle than other edge lit LED sets.5. Super Bright, and Super awesome contrast ratio. it even made my last ES6500 looked bad.6. Dynamic contrast preserves over 95% of details even in medium setting, thanks to its 500 sub region micro dimming capability. i tested it with color and gamma palettes, even in medium setting, the color information is still preserved. unless you go all the way into HIGH, which starts to crush some shadows.7. minimal to none clouding/flash lighting issues. with micro dimming on, it's completely none issue.Cons:1. slight screen uniformity issue. slight back light bleed in rare occasions. Thanks to Micro Dimming. most of the back light bleed are eliminated. the only time you'll see slight back light bleed is a thin edge of bleeding will appear on both lef/right side of the screen when hovering over a neutral color. but in all of the dark scenes back light bleed isn't an issue at all thanks to Micro Dimming.2. slight DSE/banding toward both left/right side of the screen. i only found this out when i started looking for it. and once i found it, it's hard not to forget. do yourself a favor, don't look for it. i now also find some banding on all my other monitors and TV's around the house. the banding isn't bad, and you probably won't notice unless you start looking for it. so don't.Additional comment: overall, it's a great TV. based on my previous research, it seems that if you stay away from the 65 inch set, which has the most amount of screen uniformity issue, you should be ok. i honestly couldn't find anything wrong with it the first few days. it was until i started doing all the test, and started "looking" for flaws and i found some slight banding. honestly once i found the banding, i went and look for it on my old 46inch TV set that the ES8000 replaced, i found worse banding on the old one, which to my surprise i never noticed for the past 6 years. so now i wish i had never went and looked for those issues, because now psychologically, you always tell yourself there is slight banding at a certain place, and you look for it. maybe as time goes by, i'll forget about it. in case if you're wondering if the banding is as bad as those example pictures of 65 inch on AVS forum, no, it is not. i can still watch hockey without noticing any, unless you start looking for it.EDIT: 2/26/2014do yourself a favor, pick up an Xrite Colormunki, or Xrite i1Display Pro. if you think the image is awesome on this set, wait until you calibrate it with the meter. it'll blow your mind. you'll need to use the meters with HCFR calibration software, which is free. the white balance on this set, like all other tvs in the market, are off. color temp out of factory in movie mode is over 9000 Kelvin. and there's excess Blue and Green across all color scale. Red and yellow are actually pretty accurate out of the factory. but after you calibrate it and get the white balance to D65, and using CMS on your tv to match all color reference points, the image is breath taking. i actually got a even blacker black level after calibration, and overall better perceived contrast (without the excessive blue tint).

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN60ES8000
Reviews.Author: Jim Savoy "Simple Jim"
Reviews.Content: I don't get the negative reviews, granted this type of unit must be calibrated to achieve a nominal viewing performance. For the unfamiliar user this could seem a daunting task but there are numerous web sites to visit to retrieve all the information necessary to do a quality in home calibration, I used this one coupled with my personal tastes, AVS forum.I suppose the bells and whistles are a little over the top, the hand motion coupled with the camera is a little weird, but the access to Apps is relatively easy to navigate as is the personalization. The voice controls work.....no issues there. Clearly this type technology is the future of television viewing, internet connected, streaming and personalization.The picture quality for me is excellent, viewing angles are better then previous Samsung units and the sound is better then older Samsung versions, not to say it's great though.3D is very good, it's such a personal issue....but it works for me.The design is amazing, the bezel is the thinnest in the business and the stand is very attractive. The connections are easily accessible and the basic remote is simple, the voice and motion remote takes a little getting use to. I have several Samsung TV's and this is just the latest and greatest version of a clear leader in the industry.Update:3/1/13,TV did the robotic off and on thing, vertical lines and frozen images.....broken....after 6 days of use.Looks like my luck with Samsung stuff just ran out. I guess I'll eat the return fee and move on.Any suggestions?Update:3/12/13It's going back......Samsung has a new unit coming maybe I'll try it, then again maybe not. Anyone have any recommendations for a good TV?Update:4/4/13After weeks of flailing the shipper finally took the thing away on 3/26/13. What a terrible experience. Samsung? never again.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable TV with lots of Bells and Whistles
Reviews.Author: Samtvguru
Reviews.Content: I brought this TV in July 2012 and it stopped working within 2 weeks. All the inputs (HDMI, DVI, AV, Component) could not detect any input. I contacted Samsung and they referred to the 3rd party at-home tech who advised that they would have to order a new part and that could take 2-3 weeks to fix. I preferred to return the TV instead. Why waste your time, money and ALL the hassles with this when there are hundreds of other TVs to choose from?This TV has some great picture quality, wireless internet to stream my Netflix movies and watch 3D content. But the IR blaster and the Voice and Motion controls do not work (as intended) most of the time. The Smart remote is a big pain to manage and if you are using that to type something (e.g. website address can only be typed with this), it takes a frustrating long amount of time.I would not recommend this TV to any .. instead would ask Samsung to fix the features and the bugs and make sure they all work correctly. This appears to be rushed to the market without proper testing.

Reviews.Title: Dont Buy a Samsung Smart TV
Reviews.Author: kkassim
Reviews.Content: We bought a Samsung UN60ES8000 about 10 months ago.  After only couple of days we started seeing vertical color lines instead of picture.  This is a known issue with the TVs.  We were very surprised when Samsung refused to replace it.  After waiting 3 weeks for the TV to be repaired it worked pretty good, except for the annoying voice command popping up even when no one in the room was talking.The TV has failed for the second time exact same problem.  Vertical lines, TV restarts then about 10 seconds of working then vertical lines come back and it repeats.  To our surprise Samsung will not replace but is going fix.  However TV will not be picked up for 7 days from when we called in.  We live in Houston not a small town.  We called Samsung several times and they refuse to help and don't care that our $3000 plus TV has failed twice. So tonight we have to go buy another TV, not sure which brand but for sure it will not be a Samsung.The first repair guy told me that Samsung overdrives their electronics which makes the picture look great in the store but can cause the TV to fail much sooner.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: Bullitt
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for over 4 months now and absolutely love it!. I have zero issues with it's function. Now to be fair, I did not buy this TV because of the voice commands, or for the motion commands. I actually turned these options off as I have no interest in using these features. That being said, everything else is awesome. The picture quality is second to none in my opinion. The 3D is as good as it gets. I run the 3D movies through my PS3 as it has 3D capability and does very well with this format.As mentioned in other reviews, when the scene on the TV is very dark/black, there is some "cloudiness" seen, but you kind of have to look for it. If you are engrossed in the movie or show as the case may be, chances are you may not even notice. You have to look for it. Kind of like that little itch you have, normally you don't notice it, but if you concentrate on it then it may bug you, otherwise not an issue. For some people this may be a non starter, but realistically, what percentage of your TV watching is a predominately black/dark scene or background? Be that as it may, this for me is such a non issue that I would not have mentioned it or maybe even noticed it but for the reviews that others have posted.Would I buy this TV again? Absolutely, without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: Quality control issues like before BAD "hot spots"
Reviews.Author: NateTheSkate
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this and the D8000 I decided to go ahead and pull the trigger and order one. I didn't purchase from Amazon only because I got a better deal elsewhere (I wish I would have ordered from Amazon). Samsung appears to be having some major quality control issues as in the last 3 panels I have received including this one there have been "light spots" in the screen under dark backgrounds. Originally I called Samsung and explained the issue, they said to turn the back light down to 7 and wait 3 weeks to see if the problem corrected itself...In the 4 corners of this panel it looks like something is pushing on the panel from behind the LCD screen causing a whitish haze which is clearly visible under any dark backgrounds (dark blues, blacks, greens ect.). here is a link to a photo showing the affected areas: [...]After dealing with support for countless hours I am finally getting a refund and plan to buy the new Panasonic 65" VT50 when its released. DON'T BUY THIS TV, YOU WILL REGRET YOUR PURCHASE!If the TV didn't have the spots it would be a great set. The color and quality of the rest of the panel is awesome! but who could look past those annoying spots on a purchase that's over 3 thousand?!?EDIT 5/3: Amazon removed the link to the photo, I added it in a comment under the comments section of this review for anyone interested.

Reviews.Title: Samsung refuses to replace non-working TV
Reviews.Author: Scott Speed
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Samsung UN60ES8000 60-Inch LED TV from Amazon on 8/16/2012.This TV has been nothing but trouble. It has been repaired by Samsung 2 times for the exact same problem. Now it is doing it again. What happens is the TV starts flashing crazy patterns and then turns itself off and on nonstop until you unplug it. Now it is doing it again.Samsung has replaced the “board” in the TV each time. It works for a few days or weeks then it starts all over again. Now Samsung wants to use my living room floor as a TV repair shop again. This time they want to replace the TV’s LED main panel.Every time they need to repair it I have to pay someone to take it off the wall, Samsung “fixes it” and then I pay someone to put it back on my wall. It is, after all, a 60” TV. You can’t install it on a wall by yourself. I say Samsung “fixes it” because they keep replacing the same part of the TV.I have asked Samsung to replace the TV and they refuse.Needless to say I will never buy another Samsung product again.

Reviews.Title: A Great Overall TV
Reviews.Author: kugdawg
Reviews.Content: I picked up this TV from Amazon shortly before the F series TV's came out and paid around $2200 for the 60" model.  This is a great overall performer.  I've owned a number of high end Samsung TV's including a couple of 3D plasma TV's.  This one trumps the plasmas.  The whites are much brighter and truer compared to a comparable plasma TV where whites are almost gray.  The micro-dimming ultimate and increased black levels are definitely noticeable over my 55C8000 Samsung.  Yes, black levels are not as good as they are on my 7 series Plasma, but it's very rare that I'm watching TV in complete darkness so this doesn't matter to me.The new voice and gesture control may be gimmicky to some, but I will be the first to admit that they are incredibly handy and accurate.  There is nothing better than walking into your living room and saying "Hi TV, power on" and having the TV on before you sit down.  The voice control also allows you to tell the TV to change channels, volume, and a handful of other commands without ever leaning forward to grab the remote.  (Very handy when eating!).  The gesture controls are great too.  It took me a day or two to figure out how to do the motion control properly.  You don't wave your hand like the advertisements show, you just hold your hand up and make sure there's some lighting in the room to illuminate it.  The voice and gesture controls sync with your cable box, making them useful... rather than useless.3D is nicely improved over the two 2011 3D Samsung's I own.  The TV comes with four pairs of bluetooth glasses that never lose connection if you look away from the TV like the old IR models do.  They're also very light and fit over eyeglasses well.  The 3D effect itself seems crisper and more pronounced.The app market is also a nice improvement and contains a number of board games like Monopoly, the Game of Life, and others.  Good for sitting around with a group of people.  Angry Birds is also fun with the motion control and comes free with the TV.The new touch remote isn't all that great, and I wish this TV included last years special remote with the keyboard on the back.  Although the touch remote makes web browsing much easier (think laptop trackpad), the typing is still a chore because you have to select each letter separately.  You can always sync your Samsung phone to the TV though (Galaxy models, Focus models for WP7, etc), this enables you to use your phone's keyboard to type.Other features that I haven't tried yet but may be nice are; connectivity to a wireless printer so you can print directly from web pages, Skype functionality with the built in camera, and facial recognition that can bring up each person's individual Skype phone book, app preferences (I think), etc.Overall this is a great performing TV in terms of picture quality, but also adds some great extras that you just wont get on a high end Sony TV.Pull the trigger now while the price is LOW!

Reviews.Title: A very attrictive TV with lot of fun features
Reviews.Author: J. Boyle
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the Samsung UN60ES8000 from a Samsung LN52A750.  I took advantage of Amazons free shipping.  It arrived a few days before the expected due date and had the, “White Glove” service!  I was most impressed with the delivery people care that ensured that the TV was in working order before they left.I’ve used the 8000 for around 3 months now.  The TV is beautiful with the thin silver colored bezel with very narrow black edges. The stand complements the TV.The TV came with a standard remote control and a touch pad remote control.  I much prefer the standard remote over the touch pad remote, and a remote control extender.  With the extender I have my Blu-ray and satellite DVR programmed so it matches my satellite service channel line-up.  This is a nice feature. The touch pad remote is sluggish execution responses when touching the pad.  The touch pad remote control is not as user friendly when filling in data fields with letters and numbers.  I used the Motion Control and Voice Control, I find neither beneficial. Using voice control via the touch remote gives best results.I rate the Picture quality with a “B”.  If the quality of the program is top notch, the video quality is exceptional.  If the program is less than average due to being over compressed or having a low bit rate, digital artifact becomes evident. The LED/LCD has robust color, great contrast and brightness.  I’m impressed with the quality of standard definition content. The viewing angle is narrower than my replaced CCFL/LCD.  I have a smaller LED/LCD TV.  It like this TV has the same narrow viewing angle.  This may be caused by the LED back lighting (edge lighting process) and the much thinner encasement width.  When moving to the either side if the TV, I see is the increase of white saturation similar to high Chroma.  At greater side viewing angles the washout becomes very evident.  I have not had the 8000 professionally calibrated.I have Dish Network receivers.  I find that channel video quality is not always equal.  Some channels have slight judder when the Auto Motion is set to “Standard,” or “Smooth”.  Changing it to “Clear” fixes the problem 100%, but makes the picture look flat as compared to “Standard” that makes the picture look more realistic (or the soap opera effect).  Using the “Smooth” setting actually increases judder on some channels.  “Smooth” should make the picture smooth.  I’ve tried different user settings and can emulate Samsung’s presets, but can’t get it any better.Using the Smart Hub internet features is remarkable.  The picture quality of the HBO-GO & VUDU applications is close to perfect.  I have not used every feature application in the Smart Hub but can attest that the video quality is exceptional for some applications.  I’m a Netflix subscriber and use the Netflix app.  The video quality for the Netflix app is disappointing.  This application causes what others describe as blooming in the four corners of the screen with dark to black scenes.  Data streaming may be slower making the picture looks softer with an increase in macro blocking.  Samsung and Netflix need to work on and improve this application.I using the 3D feature with Dish Network VOD programs.  The quality is average, depth could be better.  I compared quality with my 32” 3D VIZIO that has passive 3D.  The VIZIO 3D has more field of depth; the 8000 has a much better viewing angle.  My biggest complaint about the 3D is that there is occasionally a good amount of side reflection of image, usually to the left of a 3D object (like there is a pane of glass next to the object reflecting a ghost image of the object when the 3D effect is set to Auto).  Using the 3D Auto setting also causes side banding to increase and decrease depending on how much 3D content is present.  Using the 2D to 3D feature is amazing.  The quality is remarkable.The included 3D glasses work well, however other surrounding light sources will introduce lens flicker.  Corrective lens glasses are hard to position while using the included 3D glasses.  I don’t have a 3D player however playback of Blu-Ray videos provided outstanding picture quality which makes me believe that 3D would be much better when using Blu-Ray.  There is occasionally some white side banding when I first start VOD 3D playback. I found that I can eliminate it either by stopping and starting the 3D program.The audio quality is average with the built in speakers.  I’ve tried modifying the sound setting for the TV speakers.  Quality is not improved.Network setup is easy.  Using either WiFi or connecting an Ethernet cable proves positive.  There are no problems.This TV has Eco friendly user options.  I don’t use them because the TV is quite energy efficient with the standard settings.  When room lighting compensation setting is used, the picture dims to dark for my liking, even in a dimly lighted room.Module upgrades are part of the design for this TV that attach to the back.  I’m curious to learn what features and upgrades will be made available.I recommend this HDTV for those who have an unlimited budget.  For the rest  I think it wise for to wait until the price drops before taking the plunge.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: CaliChris
Reviews.Content: So I must start by saying I have not written many of these, but find myself always looking at them to make a decision on what to buy.  Spending $3K is a big decision so here is my contribution and hope it is helpful.  I have now had my TV over 90 days so lots of reviewing time.This TV is beautiful, and looks amazing mounted on a wall with a thin mount display.  The Sanus Extra Thin works great with this TV.  The minimized bezel and clean lines make this a work of art even when it is off.  I don't believe esthetically there is a better TV out there.Picture quality is amazing although the black is not the blackest but I believe that is one of the downsides of LED's.  Still so beautiful and one of the best on the market and certainly at this price range.I did not find the smart remote provided to be intuitive but thankfully Samsung likely figured this out and provides a standard remote as well that I found much easier to use.One of the major disappointments has been that Samsung has chosen to no longer to offer compatibility with their remote app for IPhone users.  This app is awesome and allows you to control the TV via an app on your phone.  It appears because these companies are now not playing nice with each other, they are taking it out on the consumers and the IPhone app no longer works with the latest TV software updates.  Lame.Lastly, I am having slight video delays at random times and have not been able to figure out why.  I have not made any calls on this but am hopeful it is something that can be resolved.  I will provide an update when I do but I am giving Samsung the benefit of the doubt on this and hoping there is an easy fix.Aside of the occasional delay, overall this is an amazing TV with amazing picture that I would recommend.  Especially if you want to nice clean look on your wall with a beautiful picture.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional Picture
Reviews.Author: Gregory Eastvedt
Reviews.Content: This LED HDTV has the most amazing picture that I have ever seen. It is almost like being on location with the actors. I have always been impressed with Samsung, but this TV has a better quality picture than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Very Sharp Picture, Super Bright Screen.
Reviews.Author: Venkata S. Pasumarthy "Subhash"
Reviews.Content: I was forced to replace my 9 year old Samsung DLP TV that I bought for $5400 in 2003. I was more looking for OLED TVs to be available for replacement of my old TV. We had no issues with the DLP TV until its motherboard gave up. This forced us to look for a new TV. Samsung ES 8000 series Television was the most appealing for its bright picture and superior contrast. More than the Gesture recognition or Internet enabled smart TV the picture appealed to me particularly. Over the Air HD TV broadcasts are stunningly beautiful. You got to see to believe how beautiful the resolution can be. Its a delight to watch any TV program mes on this Television set. You cant go wrong. I highly recommend this TV. I purchased 5 year warranty offered by Square trade to protect the investment.

Reviews.Title: Faulty display BEWARE!!!
Reviews.Author: Anand
Reviews.Content: The TV was good for 5 months and for the past 2 months I have been having trouble with the display.. It goes blank and shows multi-colored stripes then switches off itself then the issue appears again then switches off itself.. This issue comes and goes often.. Way too often now.. It's still under warranty so I ll take it to Samsung and get it fixed or replaced...

Reviews.Title: Awesome 3D HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Brent Hunter
Reviews.Content: What's not to like.  This huge screen is the best.  With no hardly any bezel (outside trim) it looks to be just a moving pictures sitting there.  Potentially any channel can be a 3D candidate but as expected some are better than most.  Very lightweight for its size which had me concerned but the durability and quality of this machine was worth it.  I had some issues getting the network up and running but finally got it.  Best to have high speed internet to watch some of Samsung 3D content (awesome).  I can't wear the glasses too long but that's okay, the regular viewing makes up for it.  It's on the expensive side but, like anything else, you want quality, you're gonna pay for it.  Starts right up and it's fast.  Hopefully with the future upgrades, it won't be "yesterdays' model" anytime soon.  Go for it.

Reviews.Title: Just freakining amazing...
Reviews.Author: R. Mallicoat
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Samsung 47 inch flat panel for the last 5+ years.  I did my homework and checked against consumerreports.org and found the Samsung line were always at or near the top (plasma/lcd/led) and my last real choice was to go with 55 inch or 60 inch and with the 8000 series...  After viewing one at the local Fry's I just had to pull the trigger...  ordered through Paul's TV on Amazon and just had it delivered this afternoon and plugged things in...  AMAZING picture and amazing set of features...  I still get comments on how nice the picture of my 5+ year TV is and this kicks its butt...  thanks Samsung...

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Rye
Reviews.Content: I love it so much! 3D is awesome..Highly recommended... One thing that annoys me is that the power cord was a quite short if you hang it to the wall...but except the power cord, everything was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: Stunning Picture BUT...
Reviews.Author: timguitartaylor
Reviews.Content: When we went shopping for a new TV, this was the latest version, and of course it looked fabulous in the stores we saw it in. The image quality is pure, clean, and so lifelike that the perception to the eye is that you are looking out your own window. The 3d effect is excellent, and has a sense of depth that implies the TV is 10 feet deep. The setup is time consuming, but once you have it all set up, it DOES work as advertised. So...why only a 2 star review? Simple. The problems we have with the TV are in it's construction. I hate to do it, but I am going to be returning my 2nd of these due to major flaws in how they put it together. It looks appealing when it is on. BUT...the problem is, at the factory, they over tighten the screws that attach the various parts, and the bezel, which is enough to distort the Gorilla Glass badly. The first one arrived, with about 8  6 inch "bowls" of distortion, and when the TV is off, and the light of day is shining into our family room, it is really annoying. Not a little bit, rather seriously irritating. My wife commented on it, and we returned the first one. The second arrived last week, and has the identical same problem. BOTH TV's also had a problem with corner stars...meaning in a dark room, at night, while switching between sources, and black is displayed on the screen, white stars shoot out out from each corner. The first TV was much worse, but between them both, we have to say, this is a consistent problem, and though we would love to consider this done, and move on to other things, it is NOT done. It makes me wonder where the quality control is at the factory, and why they are tightening screws so much that it ruins the display. This is not a new issue. I had this happen to a SONY Bravia XBR2 I bought 6 years ago, though loosening the screws relaxed it, and the problem went away.  On these displays, no such luck.  For 3500 bucks at point of purchase (now 3199 average) it ought to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: I'm concerned
Reviews.Author: Bob Harrington
Reviews.Content: Amazon delivered my UN60ES8000 at 10:30 AM Friday, July 27, 2012. The two Pilot Freight Services reps had it out of the box sitting on its pre-installed floor stand and operating acceptably within 10 minutes.Getting my components plugged in and operating well together took another half-day or so.Since I am a Comcast subscriber, getting my High Def 3D converter/DVR slaved to my new TV and working with my Comcast remote and other Samsung component equipment was critically important. The two remotes Samsung included in their TV package were approximately worthless other than you need the Menu button on the Samsung TV remote to make adjustments to settings for picture, sound, etc. Once I had those programmed the way I wanted them, I fell back to using my tried-and-true Comcast remote to select all functionality.Surprisingly, the Samsung HW-E450 Sound Bar which came as part of my $2,997.99 bundle does improve the sound quality some on Movie mode yet it cannot be turned ON by my Comcast remote; OFF yes, ON no. And, while the sound bar does have a dim display showing the sound level in numbers, the TV screen only shows that you are increasing or decreasing the sound level, not the numeric value of the level. This feature could be fixed with a simple Samsung software upgrade, but I'm not holding my breath.My concerns began with my careful reading of the 50 or so Amazon reviews for this TV before I bought it. Given my excellent experiences with several Samsung TV products over many years, Samsung got the benefit of the doubt. The jury is still out whether my faith in Samsung quality control will be rewarded or not. I certainly have faith, and wonderful experiences, with Amazon.About 12:30 PM last Sunday, August 12, my TV picture would not turn ON. The ON function worked so that the Samsung SmartTV logo appeared within 3 seconds, and the HDMI1 logo a couple of seconds thereafter, but NO PICTURE came on within 5 seconds as it had every time for the prior 2-week burn-in period. After trying a half-dozen times to turn my TV ON with no success, I called Samsung Support 1-800-726-7864. After enduring their lengthy telephone tree and getting cut-off once, I finally was connected to a live support rep. While she seemed clueless, she did write down my TV symptoms and started the process of scheduling local tech support for a prem visit between 8 AM and Noon on Thursday, August 16 (4 days away).At exactly 2 PM that same day, my TV magically came to life. Evidently (and fortunately), I had left the power ON without realizing it. Using the Menu, I investigated various time-related settings, but could find none toggled ON that logically might have caused my TV problem. Nonetheless, I toggled every time-related and energy-saving setting OFF. Motion and voice control (really annoying) were already OFF.Since then, so far, so good.TV Unlimited 1-408-733-6913, the local tech support vendor contracted by Samsung to provide premise services in Silicon Valley has phoned to say they have two replacement parts (a new power supply and control board) they think may solve the problem my TV symptoms indicate. The TV Unlimited tech is due out tomorrow.Currently, I am giving this Samsung TV 3 stars since I do not favor negative surprises with premium solid state products like this. I will keep you posted as my saga plays out.Update Aug 16, 2012: As recommended by another reviewer, I called off the service tech and am returning the Samsung TV for a refund to Amazon within their 30-day return window. It is being picked up next Tuesday. In the end, it was more trouble to accommodate a tech to service the TV than it was to return it to Amazon. And then, I would never be sure that the tech fix was really a fix, or just postponing another failure.About Sep 1, my plan is to order something to fill the now-gaping hole in my TV cabinet wall. It may be a Samsung UN60ES8000 again from Amazon, hoping for no more negative surprises. In the meantime, I am open to suggestions for a 60-inch 3D HDTV that may be better than this Samsung product. I am also interested in much better sound than the Samsung Sound Bar that came with the bundle.

Reviews.Title: Pathetic picture and voice control is junk
Reviews.Author: T.
Reviews.Content: I don't often write reviews but after using this TV for 10 days I was so shocked about what a pile of junk it is I had to warn others.Picture - The picture on this set is worse than the previous years 7050 series that I own. The black levels should be called deep gray levels. Also notorious for Samsung is getting LED white glare in the corners during dark scenes which are worse on this year's highest end TV compared to Samsung previous year's middle of the road. When I called an ultra high end audio / video store which charges $250 for calibration of EACH INPUT said, it's not worth the money. That it will not fix the poor blacks and LED white glare. It may improve it slightly but it's inherent to the TV design. I'm returning the TV and opting to buy a full array LED backlit TV or a plasma TV.Voice control - one word to describe it "junk". The only words that work are "power on" and that s only part of the time. I've had my family and friends try it. Out of 6 people standing within 6 feet its works about 20% of the time. Once sound is coming from the TV and voice commands are attempted the results go down even further.In summary, I rate this TV a 1 star purely on the aesthesis of the TV. It's the only thing going for it. My guess is that Samsung took its highest end TV from the previous year, made it thinner which hurt the picture quality and added voice and gesture control to drive sells. For $3,200 consumers want a quality picture first and foremost. This TV on picture alone should retail for $1,600. The voice and gesture control don't work and add no value. Samsung missed big with this set and unfortunately this TV does not produce a quality picture to compete with its rivals at half the price.

Reviews.Title: *****STAY CLEAR OF SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS-THEY BURN OUT QUICKLY*****
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  Maybe $2,500.00 - $3,000.00 is not a lot of money for some folks to spend on a television, but it is to me.  This is money I'll never get back, nor derive true enjoyment, nor value from due to the DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG product that I purchased.  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems as in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as the same DEFECT in many other DEFECTIVE SAMUNG models.  This defect occurs upon start-up, and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture gets progressively worse over time and continuously declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00!Furthermore, I was informed that the repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel" that costs $1,300.00 for the part plus $279.00 to install, plus taxes......all told, another $1,719.16....at which point the technician basically stated, "just buy another TV."SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at a rate of 20% per year, and that they do not repair any of their products after 4 years!  Their own repair people told me to just buy a new set!!!If I save one family the heartache of losing they're hard-earned money on SYSTEMICALLY DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS, and a company that offers zero customer service....I'll be happy!  God bless....SAMSUNG CONS:No Customer SupportSystemic Panel DefectGhosting of imagesBurn-in on screenDistorted pictureVery expensive to repair

Reviews.Title: Failed after 5 months
Reviews.Author: M. Wiltse "MWiltse"
Reviews.Content: After 5 months this tvs board started to fail.  $2000 paperweight, the repairs exceed the value.  Samsung told me they do not support thier remanufatured devices, under any circumstance.  Be careful when you buy expensive electronics from the "discount bin"... Samsungs processes for evaluating if the product is fixed are obviously poor.Buy from someone else.

Reviews.Title: 1 star is too kind
Reviews.Author: Cpack
Reviews.Content: The TV worked for 4 months. The screen started to break up and volume went out intermittently in early August. I thought it was a cable issue or possibly the receiver. I gave it a couple weeks and even bought a new receiver. The TV then started turning on and off randomly and all you would see on the screen were green blocks of color against the black background. Eventually it would turn on and off with just a black screen.I called Samsung and explained what the problems were. I was told that this particular model had issues with turning on and off. They said a software update would fix it. They took down my info and said I would receive a thumb drive in 3-5 business days. They also said it was being shipped from California via UPS.It never arrived so I called and was told that it shipped later than they anticipated. They said it shipped out of New Jersey and to wait another 5 business days.Again it never arrived.So I called again and went through the routine of verifying my name, address, etc. (as I did with with every previous call). The rep said it shipped out of South Carolina and that I should give it 5 business days. She also said it was sent via USPS (not UPS as they said in previous calls). At this point my TV had not been working for 3 weeks and the thumb drive had not arrived. I had also been told that it was shipping out of 3 different states and 2 different mail carriers. I had also asked for a tracking number at each phone call and was told that it wasn't available. After giving my address to the rep, she noticed that they had the wrong house number in their system. This was their mistake and only caught at the 4th phone call. So I asked to speak with a manager. The manager told me they would expedite the thumb drive and that I would receive an email later that day with a confirmation. I never received an email.I called the next day to tell them that I never received the email. I was then told that the software update COULD BE EMAILED to me. Are you kidding me? I had spent hours on the phone with Samsung customer service and waited 3 weeks without a working TV to then be told that I could have received the update via email.They emailed me the update and the TV worked for 2 weeks. Now it is doing the same thing as before. A technician is scheduled to come by and fix the TV next week. I has now been almost 2 months of not having a TV work that I paid a lot of money for.Samsung's customer service department is totally incompetent. They have lost a loyal customer.I will never buy another product from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: This TV is remarkable
Reviews.Author: Thomas Workman
Reviews.Content: Bouth the UN60ES8000 at Beest Buy over a year ago, maybe two. The previous ws a Sony rear Projection that had a great picture, but was sooo big and buky that it was time to replace it. After looking a few models and thinking, man Ill never buy a 3D television, I watched this one at the store.My wife and I had gone to the movies to see Avatar in 3D and I pretty much thought no at home viewing screen could ever match. WRONG! This TV has the most realisti 3D I have seen. Norml DVDs even look better. But looking at BluRay movies is a real delight. even after 2 years, I am still in awe of the picture. Truly amazing.Unlike some of the reviews, I have not had any issues with the TV. None, notta. Not a single problem. (knock on wood) I have been thinking about the EVOLUTION KIT. But after reading a few of the reviews, I am hesitant. I do welcome any comments from those who have installed the kit.I love this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: S. Estebo
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to get 3d capability and found that this television is a tremendous improvement over my Sony.  The dramatic improvement in picture quality alone was worth the price...

Reviews.Title: BEST TV EVER
Reviews.Author: Edward J. Keith "Investor"
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV experience I have ever had. I have owned many TV's of most major brands, including Panasonic Plasma TV's. This is better than all of them. Never mind the great extra features, the TV quality is perfect. The clarity and crispness of the images is extraordinary. The sound is so good I did not need to add an external speaker. I have not found any 3-D content yet, but I am hoping for an opportunity to test this feature of the TV.I set this TV to be hooked up to the internet which showed off all of the extra features. I also hooked up Apple TV. This TV has an abundance of inputs and outputs. Because I am a little hard of hearing I usually hook up a remote headset. Unlike most of the TV's I have had, this has a designated audio out that allows me to use the headset without having the TV speakers mute.I have only had this TV for three weeks so my exploring phase is far from over. So far, every feature I discover dazzles. So far, no disappointments.

Reviews.Title: Amazing.
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: This television is amazing! I got it from Amazons warehouse; which was sold as a repackaged tv, sold as like new with no damage. The TV looks great and performs flawlessly....

Reviews.Title: The jury is out
Reviews.Author: fgm393
Reviews.Content: I just bought this hdtv less than a month ago, but I do like it.  I have not used it to it's full capacity, but the 3d works very well once I realized the glasses were the active type and inserted the batteries. the picture is very sharp but I'll have to adjust the contrast a bit. This unit is pretty pricy and I hope it will stand up to my families abuses.

Reviews.Title: This is an awesome TV.  You feel like you are right in the picture with them.
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I bought the 60 inch but I could have gone with the 65 the wall was big enough but no matter what size the picture is fabulous.  The delivery took a long time but it did get here in one piece.  Very happy with Samsung 8000 series.  Would recommend this set to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Video Quality
Reviews.Author: rmt
Reviews.Content: I love the video quality of this TV. The gesture control works 50% of the time. The voice control is better with the Smart control.

Reviews.Title: This TV is AWSOME
Reviews.Author: Michael Davert
Reviews.Content: If your looking for exceptional picture (and really what else matters) this is it. 3D is cool, hand and voice - who cares. Sound was much better than 3 years ago also.

Reviews.Title: No sound when streaming amazon thru external speakers, stand doesn't swivel
Reviews.Author: joy peterson
Reviews.Content: Picture quality very good.  I personally am not interested in features like gesture control.  I want a great picture. I also want to stream Netflix and Amazon.  I have my TV connected to external speakers.  The only app I get sound from is Pandora but not Amazon or Netflix.  However if I stream thru my Sony blu ray player I do get sound. So this is obviously a Samsung issue.  Also , the TV and stand are gorgeous (to me) but it is disappointing that the stand doesn't allow tilting or swiveling, something that Sonys stand, which is similar, does allow.  Am currently in process of returning and plan on buying the Sony...

Reviews.Title: A thing of beauty
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This TV looks great mounted on my wall. It's also bigger than I expected it to be, which works out well given the odd length and layout of my living room. While it true that you can sometimes the LED lights during dark movie scenes, these scenes have to be incredibly dark. I noticed some bleed through while watching Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2, but that movie is so dark you can barely see any details in the "Movie" mode anyway. If you switch the mode back to "Dynamic", the screen brightens up a bit, you can see more of the actual movie, and the bleedthrough becomes almost unnoticeable.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING picture
Reviews.Author: WhoseAnthony
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is like looking through a mirror.  The edge to edge design is a show stopper.  Everyone that comes over is wowed by this TV.Some of the gimic stuff doesn't really work  like the voice activation and motion control but other than that its awesome.  The 3D shows little crosstalk if any and really pops.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: DiscoDen
Reviews.Content: The picture is just super clear and crisp. I see some of the reviews do their own adjustment to the picture but it looks just right for my taste. I have not used all the features yet, but I got the TV for it's great picture and it does have Amazon Prime instant video that we already belong to.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: B. Bolivar "bboliv"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for only 2 weeks, but so far find it to be great.  Luckily I have been trouble free, and the picture seems to be better than the 4 year old Samsung TV that it replaces.  Movies and TV (especially blu rays, and streaming in HD) look fantastic, but video games (Xbox, PS3) look amazing.  I used some calibration settings found online and that seems to have helped a lot with the default settings.  I haven't used the Smart Apps that much as my game consoles have the ones I use the most but agree that is seems like they require an update every single time before use and is a little sluggish in general.  I highly recommend this TV, and getting it from Amazon is a good deal as well - a few days after it was delivered the price dropped, and they honored it with the low price TV guarantee.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Goat (Greatest of All Time)
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and adjust.Love the picture and I'm still exploring all the options such as wifi and 3D. The picture does have the soap opera effect but that's easily adjusted away if you want. I watch mostly sports so I leave the soap opera effect alone because it enhances the picture.  If you're a big sports fan like I am then this TV is for you.Crystal clear picture makes you feel like you're at the event. Jump off the fence and buy this TV. The generous return policy (over a month to decide)makes it a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: Loving it
Reviews.Author: Cure MS Now "END MS"
Reviews.Content: I had bought the 40" last year and this year I had to buy the 60" just because this tv is awesome.  I loved the idea of the smart hub and maybe that was what influenced me.  But I find I rarely use the smart hub since my 40" is hooked up to my computer and I am able to use this awesome display as a computer monitor and Cable TV.  The thing that really grabbed me and everyone who sees this tv is, the clarity is so SHARP.  The backlight and the clarity is beyond description.  My 60" had a little problem with the mother board and Samsung quickly (like in 2 days) sent someone over and fixed it up right away plus they added 3 months to my warranty.  The issue developed over night and it began to show patterns and color blocks taking up the whole screen....sometimes restarting the TV would help and sometimes it didn't.  Just call Samsung.  Their customer service is awesome.The 3d is pretty good...Depending on the content is my experience.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic.  Incredibly thin and lightweight.  Picture quality is far superior to the rest of our TV's, even an older one that is also 1080p.  This is a great investment.

Reviews.Title: Great picture marred by flashlighting and clouding
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: I'll premise this review by saying that I believe that the nature of edge-lit HDTVs means they are prone to clouding and flashlighting.  However, given the price point this TV sells at, I would expect Samsung to have better QC and ensure that these sets have minimal to no clouding and flashlighting.  Sadly, this was not the case for me.  You, however, may be more lucky and have no issues with clouding or flashlighting.The Bad:- The first TV I purchased from Amazon had very bad flashlighting and clouding.  I exchanged it for the same model, and the second still had the same issues, albeit not quite as bad.  This is a deal breaker for me.  I'm returning for a different model.  Thank god for Amazon's awesome return policy.- 3D mode cranks up the brightness even more, so if you have issues with flashlighting you will notice it more during 3D movies.- TV randomly rebooted a few times, especially when using the Smart TV interface.- Do yourself a favor and turn off the voice control and gesture control.  If not, you risk the TV randomly deciding that you are trying to control it with your voice and/or hands.- Only 3 hdmi inputs.  All of my components go through my receiver, but I expect at least 4 inputs on a high end model- Horizontal viewing angles are just ok (imo).  It wasn't a huge issue for me, but for others it might be.  Watching off angle can wash out the color or make blacks look grey.- Glossy screen can be somewhat distracting in a bright room- As at least one other person has mentioned, the power cable is too short.  I don't know what Samsung was thinking here.The Good:- Picture, other than clouding and flashlighting, was very nice.  Blacks were pretty good for an LCD, especially edge-lit.  Colors were good after calibration.  Do yourself a favor and turn on the eco sensor.  This will dim the backlight in a dark room and help minimize flashlighting and clouding.  I also recommend you use the Disney WOW blu-ray to calibrate the picture.  It's very easy to use, and calibrating really helps take the picture to another level.- Tested 3D with Transformers and was pretty impressed.  I'm not a fan of the included 3D glasses, though.  I wear prescription glasses and found them a bit cumbersome to wear.- No dead pixels- wifi was simple to set up and worked great on my network- I did not detect noticeable lag during gaming.- independent adjustments for judder and blur.  This will help get rid of the soap opera effect- TV is nice and bright - can enjoy TV in a bright room

Reviews.Title: ES8000 Has a Major Defect
Reviews.Author: Nerd Herd
Reviews.Content: For those of you who are familiar with AVS Forums, this particular set has been plagued with issues.  First and foremost (and the only real issue I will go into in this review) is that the TV is defective.  Samsung knows this.  Several ES8000 sets constantly restart/reboot themselves.  The last time I counted, my set restarted 17 times in 3 minutes.  This is simply unacceptable in a high end set like the ES8000 series.  Firmware updates, resets, and every type of "fix" you might imagine has no effect on this issue.  I am truly disappointed as I have bought several Samsung HDTVs in the past (a DLP projector as well as 3 other LED flat screens).  It might be time to consider Sony.

Reviews.Title: Need a light?
Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: This TV absolutely breaks my heart.  Everything I own is Samsung (phone, fridge, other TV) and they are all tip top quality so I expected nothing but the best when I ordered this TV.  To be fair the picture on the TV, the 3D, the  picture motion are in fact some the best quality I have ever seen.  The problem with this TV comes when the lights go out.  The flashlighting and clouding from the backlight are so severe that it makes it nearly unusable at night.  I have tried lowering the backlight level to extremely low levels with no success of eliminating the problem.  As a married individual that works during the day, the only time I can play my video games are at night after the wife goes to sleep so keeping a light on is not possible nor should it be a requirement.  I have heard the clouding issue is more severe with some sets than others so I will be swapping mine out and praying that the next one does not have same problem.  If anyone has any reco's on other TVs to look at if this next one I get is no good, I would love to hear them.

Reviews.Title: Ok as a TV  But it's not very "Smart"
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The picture on the TV is good but if you are considering this unit for the "SMART" features, look elswhere.  Every time  we try to use one of the smart features or Apps it reports that an update is required to use that app which then requires a download and installation and somtimes a reboot.  If this TV was so smart it would be updating these apps in the background or when the TV was not in use instead of making you wait to be able to use it.  The other day it said it had 9 updates to install and took a half hour before we could use the TV.  A good concept with a poor implementation.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart TV
Reviews.Author: R. Braud "Hunter"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung Smart TV after being a Siny snob for 20 years.  Great sharp picture.  Sound sucks as does all LED and flat screen TVs.  Never had one that didn't need a sound system which is a pain.

Reviews.Title: Great picture (when it worked), but very buggy and the "special" features really need to be implemented betted
Reviews.Author: brian
Reviews.Content: First I want to start out by saying I'm an AVID samsung TV fan, and the picture on this unit did NOT let me down at ALL. Hands down, one of the best pictures I have seen.That being said, this TV has MANY bugs and annoying glitches that hinder it's performance. My unit would randomly turn off and back on while watching, and once it turned on on it's own. The built in camera was faulty as well (After talking to samsung, they wanted to send out someone to replace the main board). Not gonna happen after spending $2600 on a new TV. My brother in law bought the same unit and had identical issues with the power turning off an on.Samsung does know about these issues as I probably had 2-3 firmware upgrades in a matter of a month.Stay away from this TV until the bugs are worked out is my reccomendation.

Reviews.Title: Finally my husband sees that our old tv needed to be replaced
Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that my husband purchased one of the first HDTV - a plasma for 3,000 many years ago, despite he didn't find anything really wrong with the tv, despite I couldn't watch it in the same room anymore because the sound had lost some important frequencies - he finally agreed to this purchase.  We are still really happy that we made this change.  We are like children watching 3D movies and the 3D function was not an important part of our decision.  We love the beauty of the picture and it has allowed us to sit in the same room again to watch tv.  We purchased a Samsung sound bar and haven't been pleased with that purchase YET...going to let them try to fix the problem but we saved enough buying a "like new" tv that we were able to get the sound bar, a wireless headset and a 3D player!That being said, we like being able to go to our netflix account, hulu and amazon prime.  We haven't figured out how to get the BLAZE on it so we are still having to go to our Roku for that - on a different set.  I love all the different HDMI ports and that the screen takes up the entire "size" of the tv.  We have been very happy with ease of use with the 3D as it automatically takes care of the changes needed - 3D mode.  It lets us know when the 3D glasses have been activated and it seems the glasses go off on their own when we change programming.  (Thank goodness our 23 year old son was around who set everything up for us and told us that we actually have to turn the glasses on) - I'm sure the instructions would have helped us but we tend to "plug, play and just start using" before we check the instructions.  We haven't even started using the Skype but plan to make full use of that function as well.  No more "leaning over one person at the laptop" anymore when we want to chat with family.  No more of that "looking up my nose" camera angles for Skype..yeah!  We have had our tv about 6 wks now

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I bought this in September of 2013. I am very impressed with it. I have been able to use this with my Bose sound system and together it feels better than being at the Movie Theater. The apps are also very easy to use, I was also able to pair this with my Smart phone and share pictures in full screen. The sound from the TV on it's own is not as I would have expected, but then again I like loud and clear sound. So I would recommend getting a sound system to go with this.The picture quality is amazing, it feels like you are able to touch the water and grass on the screen.So all in all, this is a great system.

Reviews.Content: The quality of picture is far better than other sets. Even many older programs from the 60s and 70s make you feel like you are on stage watching live. I've owned this for over a year with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Good Product Fast Shipping

Reviews.Content: I like the TV and the 3D is pretty awesome.It will even convert regular 2D TV into 3D which is a cool feature. The voice and motion controls aren't the best but it turns on and off and changes source when I tell it too. If your gonna hang it up us 2 people the 60" is pretty heavy.

Reviews.Content: I really love this TV. The picture is  perfect. The Internet works well, I watch court trials via the internet on it for hours. The 3D is just like the theatre, or better because I'm home. The hand gesture feature is great also. I like walking in the room and asking the Tv to turn on. Yeah I love gadgets.

Reviews.Content: What a wonderful ES8000 model TV, I ever purchased. This Samsung 60 inches 1080p 240Hz with 3D, it just absolutely so fantastic tv experience. I am having a "Funtastic time" from my own down stairs...

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Vendor did not have exact TV, so they sent me a slightly better one for the same cost!  The TV is fantastic, and does everything it claims to do.  Forget the nitpickers that find some tiny problem - the picture is perfect as far as I'm concerned.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: eddie bubinski
Reviews.Content: I had previously purchased a Vizio 60" TV at a warehouse club but was very disappointed in the picture quality. I returned it and purchased the Samsung 60" 3D Smart TV from Amazon. I was a bit reluctant to buy a TV online but due to my previous positive experiences with Amazon, I took the chance. I'm telling you, the whole experience was great! This TV is awesome! The picture quality vs. the Vizio is night and day. 3D is nice but in 2D, you couldn't ask for a better picture. It's like the actors are performing in the room with you. I couldn't be happier.Amazon's price and free delivery beat all of my local big box stores and their white glove delivery team carried the TV up to my 2nd floor and made sure everything was working properly. Don't hesitate in buying the Samsung from Amazon, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: This is a really great Smart TV from Samsung
Reviews.Author: Larry R
Reviews.Content: This TV has an absolutely wonderful picture right out of the box.  The hand gestured controls and verbal commands are a bit tedious and unreliable, but do come in handy from time to time.  It just simpler to hit a button on a remote to turn the TV on and off.I used the bluetooth to setup a keyboard and mouse for web surfing.  They work much better and make surfing much more enjoyable.  I should add that giving verbal internet search dictations to your remote microphone works better than expected.  Their voice recognition is outstanding!The smart TV technology is outstanding and we really enjoy getting Pandora music through our TV.  We also enjoy viewing our years of computer photos on our large 60" screen.This is a really great Smart TV from Samsung and we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Content: Fantastic picture, almost like being there, it will take a while to get to know my way around but I am sure it will be easy enough,\Cannot say enough about the great picture. Even the older movies look great on this set.and LEAVE IT TO AMAZON TO GET TO YOU WHEN YOU WANT IT!If I have one complaint, too many remote's, one for the cable box, two for the tv, another for the dvdThis is the 2012 model and I saved almost $700.00, so far I am very pleased

Reviews.Title: Superb modern technology
Reviews.Author: Richard T. Mahoney "Gambel Guy"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on these TVs before buying the Samsung.  I am very happy.  It is easy to set up and has a vast number of capabilities, some of which I have not fully explored.  I have hooked up a Bluetooth keyboard which greatly facilitates using text based applications.  I have seen no problems with the screen in terms of shading or blotching or any other problem.  I bought the TV through Amazon because of the other reviewers' comments about Amazon's excellent responses on problems.  About one month after I got the TV, there was short in the electrical wiring which caused the TV to smoke and smell of burnt plastic.  Amazon replaced the TV expeditiously and I've had no problems since.  I might note that I am becoming a Samsung devotee much like some people are Apple devotees.  I like the nice integration and capabilities of mobile phone, pads and TVs.

The internet functions and face camera and voice commands are not really important to me. Reviews.Title: Great TV until it BREAKS
Reviews.Author: bluedog
Reviews.Content: Bought it in early Aug 2012 and it stopped working mid Nov 2012.  Now when powered on it works fine for about 15 min then the picture is replaced with multiple vertical colored lines all over the screen .  After awhile the TV automatically turns itself off and then back on and then the colored lines cover the screen again and TV goes off/on again.  The same process repeats as explained over and over and over and over....  The only way to stop it is to pull the plug.  After pulling the plug and letting it rest for several hours the same process repeats.Called Amazon to exchange the TV and I was told its outside their 30-day exchange period and so I could either get 50% of my purchase price back from Amazon or keep it and take up the problem with Samsung.  Samsung repair man is scheduled for tomorrow.Oh joy, paid full price for a new TV and will probably end up with a refurbished one.  Will have to use my old 25 inch CRT TV until this is resolved.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv, just wish it was full LED
Reviews.Author: J. Dufrene
Reviews.Content: There are more than enough lengthy, technical reviews on this tv already, so I won't bother posting another one. Bottom line, awesome tv with a great picture. My only complaint is that it isn't full LED, but unfortunately, is only edge lit. Being edge lit, there is a little light bleed. Nowhere near as bad as lesser models, but still noticeable.All in all, for a tv that's under $3,000, it's one of the best, but if absolute perfection is what you're after, I'd look for a full array LED set instead, but plan on spending the $ for it. Those sets start at $5,000 for the 55" models. I think Sony and Pioneer each have one.As far as all the other stupid "Smart" features, they make work well, but I can't stand all that stuff, so I disabled every bit of it.Also, do yourself a favor and get the tv custom calibrated. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: Rocelle F. Swann "SWANNFLOWER"
Reviews.Content: We initially ordered from Amazon A Sony Bravia KDL55NX720 TV. It was delivered quickly and was able to use and enjoy the TV for a whole month. And then ...one day I turned on the TV power and nothing happened. Did not power up. Got the Manual and tried the suggested troubleshooting...nothing worked...called the SONY customer service...the guy that got our call was a very rude person...my husband refused to deal with him anymore after having to hear absurd analogies...paying a considerable amount of money for a piece of equipment that died on us after a month of use and having to deal with a very unprofessional customer service representative was a big DISAPPOINTMENT!!! WE chose SONY because it is a SONY...it was hard to look at other brands after because we've always had SONY. Friends suggested and swore about SAMSUNG. We just didn't have any choice...We ordered this TV and we are really enjoying it right now...so far...and hoping that it would continue to satisfy us for a long period of time.There is one THING that is making me so frustrated up to this date about COMPANY's quality control policies these days...we received our box without the 4 sets of 3D glasses that were supposed to be with the order. Called Amazon and they were so nice about trying to fix it themselves so I didn't need to call Samsung myself but it still came to a point were Samsung wanted to deal with me directly. Samsung took my call...I got a case #. I got a call they already placed the order for the missing 3D glasses...that was June 1, 2012...guess what...Today is Aug. 13,2012 and haven't rec'd the glasses...called them and they said it is backordered...promised to update me as soon as they have the order in. SUCKS!!! big time...I have a 3D TV and haven't tried how it works...QUALITY CONTROL should be enforced before a product leaves the factory. ALWAYS!!!

Reviews.Content: Having this TV is like being in the movie theater. The color and clearness of everything is amazing. We have watched one, 3-D movie, Life under the sea and it is out of this world. We are still working on the applications and our remote control..but give us time and we will get it figured out. I have never watched as much TV as I am doing so now. But, who cares??? Reviews.Author: Todd Lester
Reviews.Content: I've been a Samsung customer for years. I think that they make quality products and this is no exception. I bought the 60 inch version of this set. The picture is great and much more vibrant than the 50 inch plasma that I am replacing it with. There are a ton of apps and extra features, including motion and voice control. I can't seem to get either of these features to work well in my living room, but I don't think I'd ever really use them. I've noticed that the TV has picked up voice from the show I was watching and it thought that I was trying to start a command. Outside of this, the TV is great. I just finished watching the Avengers in 3D and it was amazing! I highly recommend this TV. I'd give a 5-star if the Voice/Motion control was better implemented.

Reviews.Title: Blue vetical line across Screen - DEFECTIVE
Reviews.Author: Ghassan
Reviews.Content: This was my first Samsung Product...The picture was nice..everything look great..EXCEPT when I noticed the vertical Blue line about 12 inches from the edge of the screen. Contacted Samsung via Chat. They had me check the picture on different Inputs..No effect BLUE line still there. They then had me run a Self-Diagnosis through the menus and the BLUE line was still there on the Test Picture.. They then had me do a Factory reset again through the menus and the BLUE line was still there even on the Samsung Demo hand playing with the remote..MY CONCLUSION.. Defective TV so the RESPONSE Should be "Sorry about this Sir, we will be happy to send you a replacement TV today!"...But lets get serious! The response was you need to schedule a Technician visit after you register online (that was after giving them all the Product model number and serial numbers through the Chat of Course!).In short..Good Bye Samsung TV..It is going back ( its only been 2 weeks since I bought from Amazon!)

Reviews.Title: Which wall mount do you recommend?
Reviews.Author: mylamename "very grumpy"
Reviews.Content: I am trying to find the best ultra slim mount (not a bulky articulating or hinged mount) for this 60-inch television, and I have gotten the worst customer service from Samsung.  It seemed to me that either the Samsung WMN2000B or WMN200C would be ideal.  Online information was contradictory as to which one would work the 60-inch set,and compatibility was only listed for 2010 and 2011 models, not 2012.Multiple queries to Samsung have gotten me absolutely nowhere: refusing to help at all, contradicting themselves, telling me to ask J&J; International (Samsung Parts), and finally telling me that they don't have mounts for 2012 models so I should pick any VESA 400x400 model.  And of course, telling me that the information is in either the manual or the website.Per their suggestion, I queried Samsung Parts, which told me they cannot answer me since the mounts were only branded Samsung, not made by Samsung, and I should go back and ask Samsung.I have never found a manufacture so unwilling to recommend an accessory for a paying customer.  Let me take a different approach.Which slim mounts have people here used, and how did they work out?Postscript (5/26/2012):I want to thank the people who commented on my review; there were some promising suggestions.  For now, I am still intrigued by the Samsung slim mounts, so I ordered both the WMN2000B and the WMN2000C.  It says right on the box for the WMN2000B that it is works with the 2012 Samsung LED ES7000 and above 46"-60", despite Samsung's claims that I should order the WMN2000C, or that neither works, or that I should ask SamsungParts, who would not help at all.  I contacted them again, pointing this out, and they again sent me useless replies, not even vaguely acknowledging the specific content of my query.  I guess customer support though the internet is not a big thing at Samsung.As to the TV itself, I would say that for high definition content, the picture quality is at least as good as a Sony LCD set that I bought around 5 years ago, and probably slightly better.  For non-high definition content, the picture quality is definitely worse.  The sound quality is also a lot worse, but I guess this is why most people end up getting external speakers for these thin TVs.  I have not tried any of the bells and whistles (gesture and voice recognition, Facebook, Twitter, or whatever), and I do not expect that I will.
